actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 p.m. on June 7, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Khanna moved that the House do now adjourn.

Pursuant to clause 11 of rule 10, clause 11 of rule 1, the order of the House of January 9, 2023, and notwithstanding the requirements of clause 11(a)(1)(D), the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence: Mr. Jackson of Texas and Mr. Perry.

actions-list.header: Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to Section 1(a)(2)(A) of House Resolution 11, 118th Congress, as amended by Section 1(b) of House Resolution 78, 118th Congress, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party: Mr. Cline.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Mann asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, June 7, 2024, it adjourn to meet at noon on Tuesday, June 11, 2024, for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Mann asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Wednesday, June 5, 2024, it adjourn to meet at 2:00 p.m. on Friday, June 7, 2024. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 209
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 199

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Wasserman Schultz moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8580.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Steube amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 237
actions-list.actionItem: 169, 1 Present (Roll no. 245).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 392
actions-list.actionItem: 11 (Roll no. 244).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 333
actions-list.actionItem: 70 (Roll no. 243).
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8580 — "Making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8580 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Rutherford moved that the committee rise.
On agreeing to the Steube amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1269, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 46.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 46 printed in Part B of House Report 118-535 to prohibit the use of funds for the Department of Veterans Affairs to process medical claims for the Immigration and Customs Enforcement Health Service Corps.

At the conclusion of debate on the Steube Amendment No. 45, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Rutherford demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1269, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 45.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 45 printed in Part B of House Report 118-535 to prohibit the Department of Veterans Affairs from using its funds to pay bonuses to senior executives in the VA Central Office.

At the conclusion of debate on the Schweikert Amendment No. 44, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Rutherford demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1269, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Schweikert amendment No. 44.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Schweikert,  numbered 44 printed in Part B of House Report 118-535 to increase and decrease funding by $10 million to conduct a study on the benefits of utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) to streamline oversight, mitigate and reduce fraud, and improve data accuracy and financial management practices at the Department of Veterans Affairs.

At the conclusion of debate on the Schweikert Amendment No. 43, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Rutherford demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1269, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Schweikert amendment No. 43.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Schweikert,  numbered 43 printed in Part B of House Report 118-535 to increase and decrease funding by $1 million for the Veterans Benefits Administration to provide support for utilizing AI to expedite claims.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8580 — "Making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Fulcher to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor Travis O'Neal, Christ Fellowship Church, Port St. Lucie, Florida.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
